data.title: Kenneth Gillespie Obituary - Manistee, Michigan
data.meta_description: Kenneth Clifford Gillespie, age 85 of Leesburg, FL, passed away on June 6, 2016 at Bayview Center in Eustis, FL.                  Ken was born on May 31, 1931 in Cicero, IL, son of the late Marvin J. and Irma L. (Schimke) Gillespie.  He attended Manistee High School, and graduated with the class of 1949.  On January 18, 1952 Ken enlisted with the United States Marine Corps, serving during the Korean War until his honorable discharge on January 17, 1954.                  Ken married Letha L. Townsend August 15, 1953 at the First Baptist Church of Manistee, where he was a life-long member. Ken and his wife Letha have been seasonal resident of Leesburg, FL for the past 25 years and permanent resident for the last 2 years.                  Ken retired from Packaging Corporation of America after working there for 33 years. He was a member of the American Legion Post in Manistee, former American Legion Post Commander and was a member of the 40/8 “Voiture Tyres”.  In his younger years, Ken enjoyed hunting, riding motorcycles and watching his kids play sports. During retirement, Ken enjoyed travelling around the United States with his wife Letha, spending time with his children and grandchildren, buying and selling cars, playing cards and just drinking coffee with his friends. Ken was a gifted writer of poetry and short stories. He frequently recited poetry at special events and when just hanging out with family and friends.                  Ken is survived by his wife of 62 years, Letha Gillespie of Leesburg, FL; 2 daughters, Cindy (James) Jaskulski of Manistee and Renee (William) Ihlenfeldt of Round Rock, TX; 3 sons, Marvin (Julie) Gillespie of Onekama, James (Susan) Gillespie of Cedarville, OH and Shawn (Margot) Gillespie of Manistee; 3 sisters, Marion Fauble, Joyce (Jay) Townsend and Joan (Jerry) Hutchin; 13 grandchildren, 8 great-grandchildren; and many loving nieces and nephews.                  He is preceded in death by his parents; daughter, Michelle Gillespie; and son-in-law, Roger Perez.                 Cremation has taken place and a memorial service will be held at 2:00PM on Saturday July 30, 2016 at the First Baptist Church in Manistee with Pastor George Butler officiating.  The family will receive friends for visitation from 1:00PM until time of service at the church.  Final interment will follow at Oak Grove Cemetery in Manistee with military honors being conducted by the Manistee United Veterans Council.                  Memorial contributions in memory of Ken may be directed to the St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital, 262 Danny Thomas Place, Memphis, TN 38105                  Please feel free to share a memory or photo with Ken’s family at www.oakgrovefh.com.  The family has entrusted funeral arrangements with Oak Grove Funeral Home & Cremation Center of Manistee.
